votebox.middle.view

Interface IDrawable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IFocusable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Button, FocusableLabel, Label, ToggleButton, WriteInToggleButton

    public interface IDrawable
    From the perspective of the view, an IDrawable is any object which can be drawn to the display. This means that it has a UniqueID (which is unique across all drawable elements) and it also offers a method from which an image can be gotten.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        IViewImage getImage()
        From this method, the view can access the image for the IDrawable.
        Returns:
        This method returns the image that is associated with this drawable for the given size index.

      • getReviewImage

        IViewImage getReviewImage()
        Call this method to get the "review screen version" of any particular drawable. The review screen version of a drawable is scaled differently to fit a particular reveiw screen layout. Note that this method should be called on drawables that aren't, themselves, members of the review screen. This method should be called by behavior in said review screen drawables, in the process of determining which image represents the "currently selected drawable" of any given group.
        Returns:
        This method returns the review screen version of any drawable.

      • getProperties

        Properties getProperties()
        Call this method to get the properties that were defined for this drawable in the layout XML.
        Returns:
        This method returns the properties that were defined for this drawable in the layout XML.

      • getGroup

        ToggleButtonGroup getGroup()
                           throws MeaninglessMethodException
        Call this method to get the associated group of this drawable.
        Returns:
        This method returns the group for this drawable
        Throws:
        MeaninglessMethodException - This method throws if this method does is not meaningful for the class.

      • initFromViewManager

        void initFromViewManager(IViewManager viewManagerAdapter,
                       IBallotLookupAdapter ballotLookupAdapter,
                       IAdapter ballotAdapter,
                       IViewFactory viewFactory,
                       IBallotVars ballotVars)
        The ViewManager will call this method on every drawable after it is created. If the drawable needs to do something, it can here.
        Parameters:
        viewManagerAdapter - The drawable can use this adapter to make calls to the view manager.
        ballotLookupAdapter - The drawable cna use this adapter to look up information in the ballot. This adapter cannot affect the ballot's state.
        ballotAdapter - Use this adapter to change the state of the ballot.
        viewFactory - Use this to construct the new images.
        ballotVars - The path to the image file is here.

      • getX

        int getX()
        Call this method to get the x-coordinate at which this drawable should be drawn.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate at which this drawable should be drawn.

      • setX

        void setX(int x)
        Call this method to set the x-coordinate at which this drawable should be drawn.
        Parameters:
        x - This int will be set as the x-coordinate at which this drawable should be drawn.

      • getY

        int getY()
        Call this method to get the y-coordinate at which this drawable should be drawn.
        Returns:
        The y-coordinate at which this drawable should be drawn.

      • setY

        void setY(int y)
        Call this method to set the y-coordinate at which this drawable should be drawn.
        Parameters:
        y - This int will be set as the y-coordinate at which this drawable should be drawn.

      • getUniqueID

        java.lang.String getUniqueID()
        Call this method to get this drawable's unique ID.
        Returns:
        This method returns the drawable's uniqueid.

      • setParent

        void setParent(RenderPage parent)
        This method sets which page is the parent of this drawable.
        Parameters:
        parent - This page will be set as parent.
